summary.span: 将一个基本数据类型转换为另一个基本数据类型。

span.span: Converts a base data type to another base data type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 静态方法类主要用于在.NET Framework 支持的基本数据类型的来回转换。The static methods of the class are primarily used to support conversion to and from the base data types in the .NET Framework. 支持的基类型为， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ， ，，和。The supported base types are , , , , , , , , , , , , , and . 此外，类包括方法，以支持其他类型的转换。In addition, the class includes methods to support other kinds of conversions. 本主题包括以下各节：This topic consists of the following sections: [之间的基类型转换](#Base) [Conversions to and from Base Types](#Base) [非十进制数字](#NonDecimal) [Non-Decimal Numbers](#NonDecimal) [从自定义对象的基类型的转换](#Custom) [Conversions from Custom Objects to Base Types](#Custom) [区域性特定格式设置信息](#Culture) [Culture-Specific Formatting Information](#Culture) [Base64 编码](#Base64) [Base64 Encoding](#Base64) [其他常见的转换Other Common Conversions](#Other) ## 之间的基类型转换Conversions to and from Base Types 转换方法存在将每个基类型转换为每个其他基类型。A conversion method exists to convert every base type to every other base type. 但是，对特定的转换方法的实际调用可以生成五个结果，具体取决于在运行时的基类型和目标基类型的值之一。However, the actual call to a particular conversion method can produce one of five outcomes, depending on the value of the base type at run time and the target base type. 这五个的结果如下：These five outcomes are: - 任何转换。No conversion. 发生这种情况是当尝试从类型转换为其自身 (例如，通过调用用类型自变量)。This occurs when an attempt is made to convert from a type to itself (for example, by calling with an argument of type ). 在这种情况下，该方法只需返回原始类型的实例。In this case, the method simply returns an instance of the original type. - 一个 。An . 不支持特定的转换时，将发生这种情况。This occurs when a particular conversion is not supported. 引发以下转换：An is thrown for the following conversions: - 从转换到， ， ， ，或。Conversions from to , , , , or . - 从转换， ， ， ，或到。Conversions from , , , , or to . - 从转换到除之外的任何其他类型。Conversions from to any other type except . - 与任何其他类型的转换除到。Conversions from any other type, except , to . - 。A . 将一个字符串值转换为任何其他基类型的尝试失败，因为字符串未采用正确的格式时，将发生这种情况。This occurs when the attempt to convert a string value to any other base type fails because the string is not in the proper format. 以下转换会引发异常：The exception is thrown for the following conversions: - 要转换为字符串值不等于或。A string to be converted to a value does not equal or . - 要转换为字符串值包含的多个字符。A string to be converted to a value consists of multiple characters. - 要转换为任何数值类型的字符串不被识别为有效数字。A string to be converted to any numeric type is not recognized as a valid number. - 要转换为字符串未被识别为有效的日期和时间值。A string to be converted to a is not recognized as a valid date and time value. - 成功的转换。A successful conversion. 对于以前的结果中未列出的两个不同的基类型之间转换，所有的扩大转换，以及不会导致数据丢失的所有收缩转换将成功，并且该方法将返回目标的基类型的值。For conversions between two different base types not listed in the previous outcomes, all widening conversions as well as all narrowing conversions that do not result in a loss of data will succeed and the method will return a value of the targeted base type. - 一个 。An . 在数据丢失的收缩转换结果时，将发生这种情况。This occurs when a narrowing conversion results in a loss of data. 例如，尝试将转换实例，其值为 10000 到类型会引发因为 10000 不在范围之内数据类型。For example, trying to convert a instance whose value is 10000 to a type throws an because 10000 is outside the range of the data type. 如果数值类型的转换导致丢失精度 （即，丢失某些最低有效位），将不引发异常。An exception will not be thrown if the conversion of a numeric type results in a loss of precision (that is, the loss of some least significant digits). 但是，如果结果为特定的转换方法的返回值类型可以表示较大，则将引发异常。However, an exception will be thrown if the result is larger than can be represented by the particular conversion method's return value type. 例如，当转换为，可能发生精度损失，但不会引发异常。For example, when a is converted to a , a loss of precision might occur but no exception is thrown. 但是，如果的量太大，以至于不能表示，将引发溢出异常。However, if the magnitude of the is too large to be represented by a , an overflow exception is thrown. ## 非十进制数字Non-Decimal Numbers 类包含静态方法可以调用以将整数值转换为非十进制字符串表示形式之间实现，并且要转换的字符串为整数值，表示非十进制数字。The class includes static methods that you can call to convert integral values to non-decimal string representations, and to convert strings that represent non-decimal numbers to integral values. 这些转换方法的每一个都包含`base`允许您指定数字系统; 二进制 (基数为 2)、 八进制 (基数为 8) 和十六进制 (基数为 16)，以及十进制 (基数为 10) 的自变量。Each of these conversion methods includes a `base` argument that lets you specify the number system; binary (base 2), octal (base 8), and hexadecimal (base 16), as well as decimal (base 10). 没有一组方法将每个符合 cls 的基元整型转换为一个字符串，另一个用于将字符串转换为每个基元整型类型：There is a set of methods to convert each of the CLS-compliant primitive integral types to a string, and one to convert a string to each of the primitive integral types: - 和、 和中的指定基数的字符串之间相互转换的字节值。 and , to convert a byte value to and from a string in a specified base. - 和、 和中的指定基数的字符串之间相互转换的 16 位带符号的整数。 and , to convert a 16-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 和、 和中的指定基数的字符串之间相互转换的 32 位带符号的整数。 and , to convert a 32-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 和、 和中的指定基数的字符串之间相互转换的 64 位带符号的整数。 and , to convert a 64-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 将指定的格式中的字节值的字符串表示转换为有符号字节。, to convert the string representation of a byte value in a specified format to a signed byte. - 将指定的格式的整数的字符串表示转换为 16 位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 16-bit integer. - 将指定的格式的整数的字符串表示转换为 32 位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 32-bit integer. - 将指定的格式的整数的字符串表示转换为 64 位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 64-bit integer. 下面的示例将的值转换到中所有的字符串支持的数字的格式。The following example converts the value of to a string in all supported numeric formats. 然后，它将字符串值转回为值。It then converts the string value back to a value. [!code-cpp[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CPP/NonDecimal1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CS/NonDecimal1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/VB/NonDecimal1.vb#2)] ## 从自定义对象的基类型的转换Conversions from Custom Objects to Base Types 除了支持的基类型之间的转换方法支持的任何自定义类型到任何基类型的转换。In addition to supporting conversions between the base types, the method supports conversion of any custom type to any base type. 若要执行此操作，自定义的类型必须实现接口，定义将实现类型转换为每个基类型的方法。To do this, the custom type must implement the interface, which defines methods for converting the implementing type to each of the base types. 不支持的特定类型的转换应引发。Conversions that are not supported by a particular type should throw an . 当方法作为其第一个参数传递的自定义类型时，或者当`Convert.To`*类型*方法 (如或调用和作为其第一个传递自定义类型的实例参数，方法，反过来，调用的自定义类型实现来执行转换。When the method is passed a custom type as its first parameter, or when the `Convert.To`*Type* method (such as or is called and passed an instance of a custom type as its first parameter, the method, in turn, calls the custom type's implementation to perform the conversion. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的类型转换](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md)。For more information, see [Type Conversion in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md). ## 区域性特定格式设置信息Culture-Specific Formatting Information 所有基类型的转换方法和方法包括具有类型参数的重载。All the base type conversion methods and the method include overloads that have a parameter of type . 例如，方法有以下两个重载：For example, the method has the following two overloads: - - 参数可以提供区域性特定格式设置信息，以帮助转换过程。The parameter can supply culture-specific formatting information to assist the conversion process. 但是，它会忽略大部分基类型的转换方法。However, it is ignored by most of the base type conversion methods. 它仅使用以下的基类型转换方法。如果`null`自变量传递给这些方法，使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。It is used only by the following base type conversion methods.If a `null` argument is passed to these methods, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 通过将值转换为数值类型的方法。By methods that convert a value to a numeric type. 参数由具有类型参数的重载和。The parameter is used by the overload that has parameters of type and . 它还由具有类型参数的重载和如果该对象的运行时类型是。It is also used by the overload that has parameters of type and if the object's run-time type is a . - 通过将值转换为日期和时间的方法。By methods that convert a value to a date and time. 参数由具有类型参数的重载和。The parameter is used by the overload that has parameters of type and . 它还由具有类型参数的重载和如果该对象的运行时类型是。It is also used by the overload that has parameters of type and if the object's run-time type is a . - 通过重载，以包括参数且数字值转换为字符串或为字符串的值。By the overloads that include an parameter and that convert either a numeric value to a string or a value to a string. 但是，任何用户定义类型实现可以利用参数。However, any user-defined type that implements can make use of the parameter. ## Base64 编码Base64 Encoding Base64 编码将二进制数据转换为字符串。Base64 encoding converts binary data to a string. 数据表示为 base64 数字可以很轻松地通过仅可以传输 7 位字符的数据通道。Data expressed as base-64 digits can be easily conveyed over data channels that can only transmit 7-bit characters. 类包括以下方法以支持 base64 编码： 来回转换的字节数组的方法支持一套或与其他包含 base 64 数字字符的 Unicode 字符的数组。The class includes the following methods to support base64 encoding: A set of methods support converting an array of bytes to and from a or to and from an array of Unicode characters consisting of base-64 digit characters. - 它将一个字节数组转换为 base64 编码的字符串。, which converts a byte array to a base64-encoded string. - 它将一个字节数组转换为 base64 编码的字符数组。, which converts a byte array to a base64-encoded character array. - 它将是 base64 编码的字符串转换为字节数组。, which converts a base64-encoded string to a byte array. - 它将 base64 编码的字符数组转换为字节数组。, which converts a base64-encoded character array to a byte array. ## 其他常见的转换Other Common Conversions 你可以使用 NET Framework 中其他类执行的静态方法不支持某些转换类。You can use other classes in the NET Framework to perform some conversions that are not supported by the static methods of the class. 这些方法包括：These include: 转换为字节数组Conversion to byte arrays 类提供了将基元数值类型转换的方法 (包括) 为字节数组，从字节数组返回到基元数据类型。The class provides methods that convert the primitive numeric types (including ) to byte arrays and from byte arrays back to primitive data types. 字符编码和解码Character encoding and decoding 类和派生的类 (如和) 提供多种方法来进行编码的字符数组或字符串 (即，来将它们转换为字节数组中特定编码) 和要解码编码的字节 （即，数组将字节数组转换回 UTF16 编码的 Unicode 字符。The class and its derived classes (such as and ) provide methods to encode a character array or a string (that is, to convert them to a byte array in a particular encoding) and to decode an encoded byte array (that is, convert a byte array back to UTF16-encoded Unicode characters. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的字符编码](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md)For more information, see [Character Encoding in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md) ## Examples 下面的示例演示部分中的转换方法类，其中包括， ，和。The following example demonstrates some of the conversion methods in the class, including , , and . [!code-cpp[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CPP/converter.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CS/converter.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/VB/converter.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是将转换指定的对象的通用转换方法`value`到`conversionType`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to `conversionType`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象和`conversionType`也可以是表示任何基类型或自定义类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type, and `conversionType` can also be a object that represents any base or custom type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到适当的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 方法需要的该转换`value`到`conversionType`支持。The method requires that conversion of `value` to `conversionType` be supported. 此方法使用当前线程的区域性进行转换。This method uses the current thread's culture for the conversion. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法的用法。The following example illustrates the use of the method. [!code-cpp[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/CPP/convertchangetype.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/CS/convertchangetype.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/VB/convertchangetype.vb#1)]

block.para:
方法可以将一个枚举值转换为另一种类型。The method can convert an enumeration value to another type. 但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为一个枚举值，即使源类型是枚举的基础类型。However, it cannot convert another type to an enumeration value, even if the source type is the underlying type of the enumeration. 若要将类型转换为一个枚举值，使用 （在 C# 中) 强制转换运算符或转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中)。To convert a type to an enumeration value, use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 下面的示例演示转换来回属于一个大洲枚举值。The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a Continent enumeration value.
[!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_enum2.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_enum2.vb#5)]
方法可以将 null 的类型转换为另一种类型。The method can convert a nullable type to another type. 但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为值为 null 的类型，即使是的基础类型。若要执行此转换，可以使用强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或 （在 Visual Basic) 的转换函数。However, it cannot convert another type to a value of a nullable type, even if is the underlying type of the .To perform the conversion, you can use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 下面的示例演示转换可以为 null 的类型。The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a nullable type.
[!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_nullable.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_nullable.vb#7)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是将转换指定的对象的通用转换方法`value`到指定的预定义类型`typeCode`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to a predefined type specified by `typeCode`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到适当的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 此方法还要求该转换的`value`到`typeCode`支持。The method also requires that conversion of `value` to `typeCode` be supported. 方法不支持的转换`value`到自定义的类型。The method does not support the conversion of `value` to a custom type. 若要执行此类转换，调用方法。To perform such a conversion, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法可以更改到由指定的类型参数，如有可能。The following example illustrates how to use the method to change an to the type specified by the parameter, if possible. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype_01.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype01.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype01.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是将转换指定的对象的通用转换方法`value`到`conversionType`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to `conversionType`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象和`conversionType`也可以是表示任何基类型或自定义类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type, and `conversionType` can also be a object that represents any base or custom type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到适当的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 方法需要的该转换`value`到`conversionType`支持。The method requires that conversion of `value` to `conversionType` be supported. `provider`参数是提供进行转换的格式设置信息的实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation that supplies formatting information for the conversion. 是否以及如何使用此参数取决于基础实现。Whether and how this parameter is used depends on the underlying implementation. 如果`value`是基本数据类型，`provider`仅用于以下转换：If `value` is a base data type, `provider` is used only for the following conversions: - 转换从数字转换为字符串，或从字符串转换为数字。Conversion from a number to a string, or from a string to a number. `provider` 必须是对象，对象或自定义返回实现对象。`provider` must be a object, a object, or a custom implementation that returns a object. 但是，因为方法执行转换使用默认"G"格式说明符，`provider`参数不起如果`value`或目标类型是一个无符号的整数。However, because the method performs the conversion using the default "G" format specifier, the `provider` parameter has no effect if `value` or the target type is an unsigned integer. 如果`provider`是`null`、使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 从转换值为一个字符串，或从字符串到值。Conversion from a value to a string, or from a string to a value. `provider` 必须是或对象。`provider` must be a or object. 如果`provider`是`null`、使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. 如果`value`是应用程序定义的类型，其实现可能使用`provider`参数。If `value` is an application-defined type, its implementation may use the `provider` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `Temperature` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype03.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype03.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype03.vb#3)] 下面的示例创建的实例`Temperature`类和调用方法将其转换为基本数值类型支持.NET framework 和。The following example creates an instance of the `Temperature` class and calls the method to convert it to the basic numeric types supported by the .NET Framework and to a . 它阐释了方法包装对源类型的调用实现。It illustrates that the method wraps a call to the source type's implementation. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype03.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype03.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype03.vb#4)]

block.para:
方法可以将一个枚举值转换为另一种类型。The method can convert an enumeration value to another type. 但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为一个枚举值，即使源类型是枚举的基础类型。However, it cannot convert another type to an enumeration value, even if the source type is the underlying type of the enumeration. 若要将类型转换为一个枚举值，使用 （在 C# 中) 强制转换运算符或转换函数 （在 Visual Basic 中)。To convert a type to an enumeration value, use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 下面的示例演示转换来回属于一个大洲枚举值。The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a Continent enumeration value.
[!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_enum2.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_enum2.vb#5)]
方法可以将 null 的类型转换为另一种类型。The method can convert a nullable type to another type. 但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为值为 null 的类型，即使是的基础类型。However, it cannot convert another type to a value of a nullable type, even if is the underlying type of the . 若要执行此转换，可以使用强制转换运算符 （在 C# 中) 或 （在 Visual Basic) 的转换函数。To perform the conversion, you can use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 下面的示例演示转换可以为 null 的类型。The following example illustrates the conversion to and from a nullable type.
[!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype_nullable_1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype_nullable_1.vb#8)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是将转换指定的对象的通用转换方法`value`到指定的预定义类型`typeCode`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to a predefined type specified by `typeCode`. `value`参数可以是任何类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type. 为使转换成功完成，`value`必须实现接口，因为该方法只需包装到适当的调用方法。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 此方法还要求该转换的`value`到`typeCode`支持。The method also requires that conversion of `value` to `typeCode` be supported. 方法不支持的转换`value`到自定义的类型。The method does not support the conversion of `value` to a custom type. 若要执行此类转换，调用方法。To perform such a conversion, call the method. `provider`参数是提供进行转换的格式设置信息的实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation that supplies formatting information for the conversion. 是否以及如何使用此参数取决于基础实现。Whether and how this parameter is used depends on the underlying implementation. 如果`value`是基本数据类型，`provider`仅用于以下转换。If `value` is a base data type, `provider` is used only for the following conversions. 如果`null`自变量传递给这些方法，使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If a `null` argument is passed to these methods, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 转换从数字转换为字符串，或从字符串转换为数字。Conversion from a number to a string, or from a string to a number. `provider` 必须是对象，对象或自定义返回实现对象。`provider` must be a object, a object, or a custom implementation that returns a object. 但是，因为方法执行转换使用默认"G"格式说明符，`provider`参数不起如果`value`或目标类型是一个无符号的整数。However, because the method performs the conversion using the default "G" format specifier, the `provider` parameter has no effect if `value` or the target type is an unsigned integer. - 从转换值为一个字符串，或从字符串到值。Conversion from a value to a string, or from a string to a value. `provider` 必须是或对象。`provider` must be a or object. 如果`value`是应用程序定义的类型，其实现可能使用`provider`参数。If `value` is an application-defined type, its implementation may use the `provider` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个名为的自定义格式提供`InterceptProvider`，该值指示当其方法调用，并且返回FR-FR 区域性和EN-US 区域性的对象。The following example defines a custom format provider named `InterceptProvider` that indicates when its method is called and returns a for the fr-FR culture and a object for the en-US culture. 此格式提供程序用于所有调用方法。This format provider is used in all calls to the method. 然后，示例创建具有数组和值和重复调用与每个值的每个成员枚举。The example then creates an array with a and a value and makes repeated calls to with each value and each member of the enumeration. 该示例说明了当该方法使用参数还演示如何使用和`provider`参数以执行区分区域性的格式。The example illustrates when the method uses the parameter and also illustrates the use of the `provider` parameter to perform culture-sensitive formatting. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype00.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype00.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype00.vb#1)]

param.name: inArray

summary.span: 将 Unicode 字符数组（它将二进制数据编码为 Base64 数字）的子集转换为等效的 8 位无符号整数数组。

span.span: Converts a subset of a Unicode character array, which encodes binary data as base-64 digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.

summary.span: 参数指定输入数组的子集以及要转换的元素数。

span.span: Parameters specify the subset in the input array and the number of elements to convert.

returns.span: 等效于 中位于 位置的 元素的 8 位无符号整数数组。

span.span: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers equivalent to elements at position in .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 由组成 base 64 数字、 空白字符和尾随填充字符。`inArray` is composed of base-64 digits, white-space characters, and trailing padding characters. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", lowercase characters "a" to "z", numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 空白字符，其 Unicode 名称和十六进制码位，将选项卡 （字符表，U + 0009），换行符 （换行符，U + 000A） 回车 （回车符、 U + 000d） 和空白 （空格，U + 0020）。The white-space characters, and their Unicode names and hexadecimal code points, are tab (CHARACTER TABULATION, U+0009), newline (LINE FEED, U+000A), carriage return (CARRIAGE RETURN, U+000D), and blank (SPACE, U+0020). 任意数目的空白字符可以出现在`inArray`因为所有空白字符将被都忽略。An arbitrary number of white-space characters can appear in `inArray` because all white-space characters are ignored. 毫无字符、"="、 用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. 结束`inArray`可以包含零个、 一个，或两个填充字符。The end of `inArray` can consist of zero, one, or two padding characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要解码的所有数据的单个字符数组。The method is designed to process a single character array that contains all the data to be decoded. 要解码的 base-64 字符数据从流，请使用类。To decode base-64 character data from a stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了利用方法进行解码容易被解码 (base 64) 数据，并将其保存为二进制输出。The following example demonstrates the use of the method to decode UUencoded (base-64) data and save it as binary output. [!code-cpp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CPP/class1.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CS/class1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/VB/class1.vb#3)] 下面的示例演示和方法。The following example demonstrates the and methods. 输入划分为三个字节数 （24 位） 的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组由其中每个数字的范围从十进制 0 到 63 的四个 6 位数字组成。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有 85 具有 1 个字节剩余的 3 字节组。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含的十六进制值 00、 01 和 02，其生成四个 6 位值等于十进制 0、 0、 4 和 2。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于 base 64 数字、"A"、"A"、"E"和"C"开头的输出。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits, "A", "A", "E", and "C", at the beginning of the output. 如果整数 3 字节组不存在，剩下的字节进行有效地填充了零以形成完整的组。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一字节的值是十六进制 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 第一个 6 位相等到十进制 63，对应于 base 64 数字"/"在输出的末尾，且是下一步的 2 位填充了零以生成十进制的 48，对应于 base 64 数字、"w"。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个 6 位值为空白，并对应于无值填充字符，"="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CPP/tb64ca.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CS/tb64ca.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/VB/tb64ca.vb#1)]

param.name: s
param.span: 要转换的字符串。

summary.span: 将指定的字符串（它将二进制数据编码为 Base64 数字）转换为等效的 8 位无符号整数数组。

span.span: Converts the specified string, which encodes binary data as base-64 digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s` 由组成 base 64 数字、 空白字符和尾随填充字符。`s` is composed of base-64 digits, white-space characters, and trailing padding characters. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", lowercase characters "a" to "z", numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 空白字符，其 Unicode 名称和十六进制码位，将选项卡 （字符表，U + 0009），换行符 （换行符，U + 000A） 回车 （回车符、 U + 000d） 和空白 （空格，U + 0020）。The white-space characters, and their Unicode names and hexadecimal code points, are tab (CHARACTER TABULATION, U+0009), newline (LINE FEED, U+000A), carriage return (CARRIAGE RETURN, U+000D), and blank (SPACE, U+0020). 任意数目的空白字符可以出现在`s`因为所有空白字符将被都忽略。An arbitrary number of white-space characters can appear in `s` because all white-space characters are ignored. 毫无字符、"="、 用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. 结束`s`可以包含零个、 一个，或两个填充字符。The end of `s` can consist of zero, one, or two padding characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字符串包含要解码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single string that contains all the data to be decoded. 要解码的 base-64 字符数据从流，请使用类。To decode base-64 character data from a stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将一个字节数组转换为 Uuencode (base 64) 的字符串，然后调用方法还原原始的字节数组。The following example uses the method to convert a byte array to a UUencoded (base-64) string, and then calls the method to restore the original byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String2.vb#1)] 下面是创建一个 32 位整数的 20 个元素数组的更复杂示例。The following is a more complex example that creates a 20-element array of 32-bit integers. 然后，它使用方法将每个元素转换为字节数组时，将它存储在缓冲区中的适当位置通过调用方法。It then uses the method to convert each element into a byte array, which it stores in the appropriate position in a buffer by calling the method. 此缓冲区然后传递给方法来创建 Uuencode (base 64) 的字符串。This buffer is then passed to the method to create a UUencoded (base-64) string. 然后，它调用方法进行解码 Uuencode 的字符串，并调用方法将四个字节 （32 位整数的大小） 的每个集转换为整数。It then calls the method to decode the UUencoded string, and calls the method to convert each set of four bytes (the size of a 32-bit integer) to an integer. 示例输出显示已成功地还原原始数组。The output from the example shows that the original array has been successfully restored. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String.vb#2)]

summary.span: 将 8 位无符号整数数组的子集转换为用 Base64 数字编码的 Unicode 字符数组的等价子集。

summary.span: 参数将子集指定为输入和输出数组中的偏移量和输入数组中要转换的元素数。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 子集`length`元素`inArray`位置开始`offsetIn`、 结果作为数字值和转换为中的元素子集`outArray`位置开始`offsetOut`。The subset of `length` elements of `inArray` starting at position `offsetIn`, are taken as a numeric value and converted to a subset of elements in `outArray` starting at position `offsetOut`. 返回值指示在转换后的元素数`outArray`。The return value indicates the number of converted elements in `outArray`. 子集`outArray`base 64 位数字组成。The subset of `outArray` consists of base-64 digits. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 毫无字符、"="、 用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数均为 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offsetIn`和`offsetOut`参数是从零开始的数组位置。The `offsetIn` and `offsetOut` parameters are zero-based array positions. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要从字节流中创建的 base 64 字符数组，使用类。To create a base-64 character array from a byte stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法进行 UUencode （以 base 64 编码） 二进制流，然后保存到文件的编码。The following example demonstrates using the method to UUencode (encode in base 64) a binary stream, then save the encoding to a file. [!code-cpp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CPP/class1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CS/class1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/VB/class1.vb#2)]

summary.span: 将 8 位无符号整数数组的子集转换为用 Base64 数字编码的 Unicode 字符数组的等价子集。

span.span: Converts a subset of an 8-bit unsigned integer array to an equivalent subset of a Unicode character array encoded with base-64 digits.

summary.span: 参数指定作为输入和输出数组中偏移量的子集、输入数组中要转换的元素数以及是否在输出数组中插入分行符。

span.span: Parameters specify the subsets as offsets in the input and output arrays, the number of elements in the input array to convert, and whether line breaks are inserted in the output array.

returns.span: 包含 中的字节数的 32 位带符号整数。

span.span: A 32-bit signed integer containing the number of bytes in .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 子集`length`元素`inArray`参数位置开始`offsetIn`、 结果作为数字值和转换为中的元素子集`outArray`参数位置开始`offsetOut`。The subset of `length` elements of the `inArray` parameter starting at position `offsetIn`, are taken as a numeric value and converted to a subset of elements in the `outArray` parameter starting at position `offsetOut`. 返回值指示在转换后的元素数`outArray`。The return value indicates the number of converted elements in `outArray`. 子集`outArray`base 64 位数字组成。The subset of `outArray` consists of base-64 digits. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 毫无字符"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数均为 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offsetIn`和`offsetOut`参数是从零开始的数组位置。The `offsetIn` and `offsetOut` parameters are zero-based array positions. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要从字节流中创建的 base 64 字符数组，使用类。To create a base-64 character array from a byte stream, use the class. 如果`options`参数设置为和转换的输出的长度超过 76 个字符，插入一个分行符每 76 个字符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 作为一个回车符 (U + 000d) 是一条线后接源字符 (U + 000A) 定义一个分行符。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045，"多用途 Internet 邮件扩展" [ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 输入划分为三个字节数 （24 位） 的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组由其中每个数字的范围从十进制 0 到 63 的四个 6 位数字组成。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有 85 具有 1 个字节剩余的 3 字节组。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含的十六进制值 00、 01 和 02，其生成四个 6 位值等于十进制 0、 0、 4 和 2。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于 base 64 数字"A"、"A"、"E"和"C"开头的输出。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits "A", "A", "E", and "C" at the beginning of the output. 如果整数 3 字节组不存在，剩下的字节进行有效地填充了零以形成完整的组。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一字节的值是十六进制 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 第一个 6 位相等到十进制 63，对应于 base 64 数字"/"在输出的末尾，且是下一步的 2 位填充了零以生成十进制的 48，对应于 base 64 数字、"w"。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个 6 位值为空白，并对应于无值填充字符，"="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CPP/tb64ca.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CS/tb64ca.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/VB/tb64ca.vb#1)]

summary.span: 将 8 位无符号整数数组的值转换为其用 Base64 数字编码的等效字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts the value of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToBase64String (byte[] inArray);
.method public static hidebysig string ToBase64String(unsigned int8[] inArray) cil managed
Public Shared Function ToBase64String (inArray As Byte()) As String
public: static System::String ^ ToBase64String(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ inArray);

param.name: inArray
param.span: 8 位无符号整数数组。

span.span: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.

summary.span: 将 8 位无符号整数的数组转换为其用 Base64 数字编码的等效字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits.

returns.span: 的内容的字符串表示形式，以 Base64 表示。

span.span: The string representation, in base 64, of the contents of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`为数字值，并且转换为用 base64 数字编码的字符串表示形式。The elements of `inArray` are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 毫无字符、"="、 用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要将数据从流的编码，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 通常，方法不是使用保存/还原容易被解码 (base 64 编码) 字符串。Ordinarily, the method is not used to round-trip a UUEncoded (base-64 encoded) string. 也就是说，如果通过调用解码字符串方法，然后对返回的字节数组进行调用编码方法，生成的字符串将不一定能与相同的原始字符串。That is, if you decode a string by calling the method, then encode the returned byte array by calling the method, the resulting string will not necessarily be identical to the original string. 字符串，则会保存/还原仅的原始字符串是有效的 base-64 编码的字符串。The string will round-trip only if the original string is a valid base-64 encoded string. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将一个字节数组转换为 Uuencode (base 64) 的字符串，然后调用方法还原原始的字节数组。The following example uses the method to convert a byte array to a UUencoded (base-64) string, and then calls the method to restore the original byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String2.vb#1)] 下面是创建一个 32 位整数的 20 个元素数组的更复杂示例。The following is a more complex example that creates a 20-element array of 32-bit integers. 然后，它使用方法将每个元素转换为字节数组时，将它存储在缓冲区中的适当位置通过调用方法。It then uses the method to convert each element into a byte array, which it stores in the appropriate position in a buffer by calling the method. 此缓冲区然后传递给方法来创建 Uuencode (base 64) 的字符串。This buffer is then passed to the method to create a UUencoded (base-64) string. 然后，它调用方法进行解码 Uuencode 的字符串，并调用方法将四个字节 （32 位整数的大小） 的每个集转换为整数。It then calls the method to decode the UUencoded string, and calls the method to convert each set of four bytes (the size of a 32-bit integer) to an integer. 示例输出显示已成功地还原原始数组。The output from the example shows that the original array has been successfully restored. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String.vb#2)]

summary.span: 将 8 位无符号整数的数组转换为其用 Base64 数字编码的等效字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits.

summary.span: 参数指定是否在返回值中插入分行符。

span.span: A parameter specifies whether to insert line breaks in the return value.

returns.span: 中元素的字符串表示形式，以 Base64 表示。

span.span: The string representation in base 64 of the elements in .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`参数作为数字值，并且将其转换为 base 64 的字符串表示形式。The elements of the `inArray` parameter are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 毫无字符"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要将数据从流的编码，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 如果`options`参数设置为和转换的输出的长度超过 76 个字符，插入一个分行符每 76 个字符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 作为一个回车符 (U + 000d) 是一条线后接源字符 (U + 000A) 定义一个分行符。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 由于换行符处换行被视为以 base 64 编码的空白字符，因此将转换的 base-64 编码字符串返回到字节数组时，将忽略它们。Because line breaks are considered whitespace characters in a base-64 encoding, they are ignored when converting a base-64 encoded string back to a byte array. 为控件或的设备如控制台窗口中显示编码的字符串时，将只需非常方便分行符。The line breaks are simply convenient when displaying the encoded string to a control or a device such as a console window. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045，"多用途 Internet 邮件扩展" [ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例调用与要插入行自变量将在生成的编码 100 元素字节数组的字符串中中断。The following example calls the with a argument to insert line breaks in the string that is produced by encoding a 100-element byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String3.vb#3)] 如示例所示，输出成功还原原始的字节数组中; 在行中断符将忽略此转换过程。As the output from the example shows, the succeeds in restoring the original byte array; the line break characters are ignored during the conversion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`为数字值，并且转换为 base 64 的字符串表示形式。The elements of `inArray` are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 毫无字符、"="、 用于尾随填充。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数均为 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offset`参数是从零开始。The `offset` parameter is zero-based. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要将数据从流的编码，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class.

summary.span: 将 8 位无符号整数数组的子集转换为其用 Base64 数字编码的等效字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts a subset of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits.

summary.span: 参数指定作为输入数组中偏移量的子集、数组中要转换的元素数以及是否在返回值中插入分行符。

span.span: Parameters specify the subset as an offset in the input array, the number of elements in the array to convert, and whether to insert line breaks in the return value.

span.span: The string representation in base 64 of elements of , starting at position .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 元素`inArray`参数作为数字值，并且将其转换为 base 64 的字符串表示形式。The elements of the `inArray` parameter are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 从零开始的升序 base 64 数字是否为大写字符"A"到"Z"、 小写字符"a"到"z"、 数字"0"到"9"和符号"+"和"/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 毫无字符"="用于尾随填充。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. `offset`和`length`参数均为 32 位有符号的数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offset`参数是从零开始。The `offset` parameter is zero-based. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理单个字节数组，其中包含要编码的所有数据。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要将数据从流的编码，使用类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 如果`options`参数设置为和转换的输出的长度超过 76 个字符，插入一个分行符每 76 个字符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 作为一个回车符 (U + 000d) 是一条线后接源字符 (U + 000A) 定义一个分行符。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045，"多用途 Internet 邮件扩展" [ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 输入划分为三个字节数 （24 位） 的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组由其中每个数字的范围从十进制 0 到 63 的四个 6 位数字组成。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有 85 具有 1 个字节剩余的 3 字节组。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含的十六进制值 00、 01 和 02，其生成四个 6 位值等于十进制 0、 0、 4 和 2。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于 base 64 数字"A"、"A"、"E"和"C"开头的输出。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits "A", "A", "E", and "C" at the beginning of the output. 如果整数 3 字节组不存在，剩下的字节进行有效地填充了零以形成完整的组。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一字节的值是十六进制 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 第一个 6 位相等到十进制 63，对应于 base 64 数字"/"在输出的末尾，且是下一步的 2 位填充了零以生成十进制的 48，对应于 base 64 数字、"w"。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个 6 位值为空白，并对应于无值填充字符，"="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". remarks.format: ## Remarks 要成功转换发生，`value`参数必须等于，其值是一个常数`True`， ，其值是一个常数`False`，或它必须是`null`。For a successful conversion to occur, the `value` parameter must equal either , a constant whose value is `True`, , a constant whose value is `False`, or it must be `null`. 在比较`value`与和，该方法将忽略大小写以及前导和尾随空格。In comparing `value` with and , the method ignores case as well as leading and trailing white space. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将各种字符串转换为布尔值。The following example uses the method to convert various strings to Boolean values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法相当于传递`value`到方法。Using the method is equivalent to passing `value` to the method. 使用当前线程区域性的格式设置约定解释 `value`。`value` is interpreted by using the formatting conventions of the current thread culture. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个字符串数组，并尝试将转换到每个字符串。The following example defines a string array and attempts to convert each string to a . 请注意，当`null`字符串分析为零，引发。Note that while a `null` string parses to zero, throws a . 另请注意，虽然前导空格和尾随空格将成功进行分析，格式符号，货币符号，如组分隔符或小数点分隔符不这样做。Also note that while leading and trailing spaces parse successfully, formatting symbols, such as currency symbols, group separators, or decimal separators, do not. remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `ByteString` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `ByteString` class that implements the interface. 该类存储的字符串表示形式的登录字段中，以及一个字节值，以便它能够表示这两个字节有符号和无符号字节值。The class stores the string representation of a byte value along with a sign field, so that it is able to represent both signed and unsigned byte values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte3.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte3.vb#12)] 下面的示例实例化多个`ByteString`对象，并调用方法来将它们转换为字节值。The following example instantiates several `ByteString` objects and calls the method to convert them to byte values. 它阐释了方法包装对的调用要转换的对象的方法。It illustrates that the method wraps a call to the method of the object to be converted. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte3.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte3.vb#13)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 是获取的实例对象。`provider` is an instance that obtains a object. 对象提供的格式的区域性特定信息`value`。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果`provider`是`null`、对象使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个自定义对象，将定义为"pos"和负号为"neg"，它调用中使用的正号方法。The following example creates a custom object that defines the positive sign as "pos" and the negative sign as "neg", which it uses in calls to the method. 然后，它调用方法重复将转换为字符串数组中的每个元素值。It then calls the method repeatedly to convert each element in a string array to a value. param.name: value

summary.span: 将指定基数的数字的字符串表示形式转换为等效的 8 位无符号整数。

span.span: Converts the string representation of a number in a specified base to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer.

span.span: An 8-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅，方法假设`value`使用无符号的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，所有的 8 位用于表示的数字值，因而缺少符号位。In other words, all eight bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码在其中一个有符号的字节值超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed byte value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换到其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"to 128 0x80 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80 converts to 128." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#3)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法或运算符在使用了适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种，确保该方法不会不恰当地使用未签名的二进制表示形式转换为十六进制字符串表示形式时，为值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use unsigned binary representation when it converts a hexadecimal string representation to a value. 该示例可确定某个值是否表示带符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 值在该示例将转换回到值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value back to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 因此，并且其高顺序位已被设置 （这指示的值为负，并且它使用两个是而不是无符号的二进制表示形式的补数），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the value is negative and that it uses two's complement instead of unsigned binary representation), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#4)] ## Examples 下面的示例或者尝试将解释为二进制、 八进制、 十进制和十六进制值的表示形式的字符串数组。The following example alternately attempts to interpret an array of strings as the representation of binary, octal, decimal, and hexadecimal values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte2.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte2.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`value`不`null`，返回值是对调用的结果方法`value`使用中的格式设置信息初始化为当前区域性的对象。If `value` is not `null`, the return value is the result of invoking the method on `value` using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current culture. `value`参数必须包含的表示形式的日期和时间格式之一中所述主题。The `value` argument must contain the representation of a date and time in one of the formats described in the topic. 如果 `value` 为 `null`，则此方法返回 。If `value` is `null`, the method returns . 此方法尝试分析`value`完全并避免引发。This method tries to parse `value` completely and avoid throwing a . 它会完成缺少月、 日和年信息与当前日期。It completes missing month, day, and year information with the current date. 如果`value`包含仅日期而没有时间，此方法采用午夜的时间。If `value` contains only a date and no time, this method assumes a time of midnight. 任何前导、 内部或尾随空白字符中的`value`将被忽略。Any leading, inner, or trailing white-space characters in `value` are ignored. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将转换的日期和时间，以的各种字符串表示形式之间值。The following example uses the method to convert various string representations of dates and times to values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是，它表示日期，`provider`无法提供有关用于表示该日期的表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a date, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that date. `provider` 中的转换会涉及到`value`的运行时类型是否`value`是，或者如果`value`是用户定义类型，该类型实现利用`provider`。`provider` is involved in the conversion of `value` if the runtime type of `value` is a , or if `value` is a user-defined type whose implementation makes use of `provider`. 如果运行时类型的`value`是和`provider`是`null`、使用表示当前线程区域性的对象。If the runtime type of `value` is and `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例定义自定义格式提供程序， `CustomProvider`、 其方法输出到控制台，它已调用，然后返回消息其名称作为参数传递给其类的区域性的对象构造函数。The following example defines a custom format provider, `CustomProvider`, whose method outputs a message to the console that it has been invoked, and then returns the object of the culture whose name was passed as a parameter to its class constructor. 其中每个`CustomProvider`对象用于将一个对象数组中的元素转换为日期和时间值。Each of these `CustomProvider` objects is used to convert the elements in an object array to date and time values. 输出指示`CustomProvider`转换中使用对象时，才的一种`value`参数是。The output indicates that the `CustomProvider` object is used in the conversion only when the type of the `value` parameter is a . remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法相当于传递`value`到方法。Using the method is equivalent to passing `value` to the method. 使用当前线程区域性的格式设置约定解释 `value`。`value` is interpreted by using the formatting conventions of the current thread culture. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用`ToDecimal`。The following example illustrates the use of `ToDecimal`. 它将尝试转换到，并引发可能在转换期间可能出现的异常。It attempts to convert a to a , and throws the possible exceptions that may arise during the conversion. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `Temperature` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数值表示形式，不支持负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将最高序位二进制位的整数 （位 15） 解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of an integer (bit 15) as its sign bit. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码非基数为 10 号，超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例递增一个将生成的数字转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，，然后调用方法。The following example increments by one, converts the resulting number to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"to-32768 0x8000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000 converts to -32768." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#5)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，你可以确保正确地方法处理溢出通过第一个检索之前将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式的数字值的符号。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first retrieving the sign of the numeric value before converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为正，而转换回整数的结果值为负，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was positive but the conversion back to an integer yields a negative value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#6)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试解释十六进制字符串形式的字符串数组中每个元素，并将其转换为 16 位有符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in a string array as a hexadecimal string and to convert it to a 16-bit signed integer. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数值表示形式，不支持负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将一个整数 （第 31 位） 的高序位二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of an integer (bit 31) as its sign bit. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码非基数为 10 号，超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例递增一个将生成的数字转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，，然后调用方法。The following example increments by one, converts the resulting number to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"to 介于-2147483648 0x80000000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80000000 converts to -2147483648." [!code-cpp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cpp/toint_str_int32.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#1)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，你可以确保正确地方法处理溢出通过第一个检索之前将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式的数字值的符号。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first retrieving the sign of the numeric value before converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为正，而转换回整数的结果值为负，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was positive but the conversion back to an integer yields a negative value. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cpp/toint_str_int32.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示数，`provider`无法提供有关用于表示该数字表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个类以实现和实现类。The following example defines a class that implements and a class that implements . 实现类的对象保存的数组值。Objects of the class that implements hold an array of values. 每个类的对象传递给`ToInt64`方法。An object of each class is passed to the `ToInt64` method. 此方法返回的数组的平均值使用实现的对象的值来确定如何计算平均值。This method returns an average of the array of values, using the object that implements to determine how to calculate the average. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method on `value`. `provider` 是`IFormatProvider`获取的实例对象。`provider` is an `IFormatProvider` instance that obtains a object. `NumberFormatInfo`对象提供的格式的区域性特定信息`value`。The `NumberFormatInfo` object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果`provider`是`null`、`NumberFormatInfo`使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the `NumberFormatInfo` for the current culture is used. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义会将字符串"pos"识别为正号和字符串"neg"为负号的对象。The following example defines a custom object that recognizes the string "pos" as the positive sign and the string "neg" as the negative sign. 它会尝试将数字的字符串数组的每个元素转换为整数使用这两个此提供程序和用于固定区域性的提供程序。It then attempts to convert each element of a numeric string array to an integer using both this provider and the provider for the invariant culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数值表示形式，不支持负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将长整型 （第 63 位） 的高序位二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of a long integer (bit 63) as its sign bit. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码非基数为 10 号，超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换到其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息，"为-1 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF converts to -1." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#7)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，你可以确保正确地方法处理溢出通过先确定一个值是否表示一个无符号或带符号的类型时将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first determining whether a value represents an unsigned or a signed type when converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为无符号的类型，但转换回整数结果的符号位的值，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was an unsigned type but the conversion back to an integer yields a value whose sign bit is on. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为非 base 10 的数值表示形式，不支持负号方法假定负数使用 2 的补数表示。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two’s complement representation. 换而言之，此方法始终将一个字节 （7 位） 的高顺序位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the high-order bit of a byte (bit 7) as its sign bit. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码非基数为 10 号，超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换到其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息，"为-1 0xff 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0xff converts to -1." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#9)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，你可以确保正确地方法处理溢出通过先确定一个值是否表示一个无符号或带符号的类型时将其转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first determining whether a value represents an unsigned or a signed type when converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为无符号的类型，但返回到一个有符号字节转换的结果是其符号位的值，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was an unsigned type but the conversion back to a signed byte yields a value whose sign bit is on. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#10)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试以便将它们转换为无符号字节解释为 binary，八进制，字符串数组中的元素和的数字值的十六进制表示形式。The following example attempts to interpret the elements in a string array as the binary, octal, and hexadecimal representation of numeric values in order to convert them to unsigned bytes. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示数，`provider`无法提供有关用于表示该数字表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `Temperature` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface. 其实现方法返回一个私有的内部值表示温度的变量。Its implementation of the method returns the internal value of a private variable that represents the temperature. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`value`为正和`toBase`是 2、 8 或 16，则返回的字符串将使用符号数值表示法。If `value` is positive and `toBase` is 2, 8, or 16, the returned string uses sign-and-magnitude representation. 如果`value`为负和`toBase`是 2、 8 或 16，则返回的字符串将使用 2 的补数表示。If `value` is negative and `toBase` is 2, 8, or 16, the returned string uses two's complement representation. 这意味着高序位字节 （位 15） 的高顺序位被解释为符号位。This means that the high-order bit of the high-order byte (bit 15) is interpreted as the sign bit. 如果方法调用来创建一个更高版本将转换回数字的字符串时，应调用采用类似的数字表示形式的相应方法来执行转换。If the method is called to create a string that will later be converted back to a number, a corresponding method that assumes a similar numeric representation should be called to perform the conversion. 此类方法包括和。Such methods include and . ## Examples 下面的示例将 16 位有符号整数的数组中每个元素转换为其等效的二进制、 八进制、 十进制和十六进制字符串表示形式。The following example converts each element in an array of 16-bit signed integers to its equivalent binary, octal, decimal, and hexadecimal string representations. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`value`参数实现接口，方法调用实现`value`。If the `value` parameter implements the interface, the method calls the implementation of `value`. 否则为如果`value`参数实现接口，方法调用其实现。Otherwise, if the `value` parameter implements the interface, the method calls its implementation. 如果`value`实现两个接口，方法调用`value`参数的`ToString()`方法，与`provider`参数将被忽略。If `value` implements neither interface, the method calls the `value` parameter's `ToString()` method, and the `provider` parameter is ignored. `provider`如果使用参数`value`参数实现或接口。The `provider` parameter is used if the `value` parameter implements the or interface. 最常见的用途`provider`参数是指定的转换中使用的区域性特定信息`value`。The most common use of the `provider` parameter is to specify culture-specific information used in the conversion of `value`. 例如，如果`value`参数是负数的十进制数字，`provider`参数可以提供有关使用负号和小数分隔符的表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if the `value` parameter is a negative decimal number, the `provider` parameter can supply culture-specific information about the notation used for the negative sign and decimal separator. 下一节中的第二个示例阐释了一个格式提供程序不提供区分区域性的格式设置信息。The second example in the next section illustrates a format provider that does not supply culture-sensitive formatting information. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`Temperature`类，并重写方法，但未实现接口。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that overrides the method but does not implement the interface. 该示例演示如何调用方法，反过来，调用`Temperature.ToString`方法。The example illustrates how calls to the method, in turn, call the `Temperature.ToString` method. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToString2#26](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/cs/tostring5.cs#26)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToString2#26](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/vb/tostring5.vb#26)] 下面的示例定义`Temperature`类，该类实现接口，但未实现接口。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface but does not implement the interface. 其实现表示`Temperature`中摄氏度、 华氏度或开氏，具体取决于格式字符串的值。Its implementation represents the `Temperature` value in Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin, depending on the format string. 该示例还定义`TemperatureProvider`类，该类实现并提供随机生成的格式化字符串，它由实现`Temperature`类。The example also defines a `TemperatureProvider` class that implements and provides a randomly generated format string that is used by the implementation of the `Temperature` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToString2#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/cs/tostring_obj30.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToString2#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/vb/tostring_obj30.vb#30)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示数，`provider`无法提供有关用于表示该数字表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`HexString`类，该类实现接口，并且设计为保存这两个 16 位有符号和 16 位无符号的值的字符串表示。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 16-bit signed and 16-bit unsigned values. 该类包括`Sign`属性，指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_3.vb#16)] 下面的示例演示调用方法传递`HexString`对象作为参数，反过来，调用实现`HexString`类。The following example shows that a call to the method that passes a `HexString` object as a parameter, in turn, calls the implementation of the `HexString` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_3.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_3.vb#17)]
