remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅，方法假设`value`使用无符号的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，所有的 16 位用于表示的数字值，因而缺少符号位。In other words, all 16 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码在其中一个带符号的整数值超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换到其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"to 32768 0x8000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000 converts to 32768." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#11)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法或运算符在使用了适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了确保，该方法不恰当地使用二进制表示形式来解释转换的十六进制字符串时使用 2 的补数表示的值的一种值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例可确定某个值是否表示带符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当此示例将值转换为值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，且其高顺序位被设置 （这表明原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#12)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将解释为十六进制值的数字的字符串数组中每个元素并将其转换为 16 位无符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned 16-bit integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_2.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_2.vb#15)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示数，`provider`无法提供有关用于表示该数字表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`HexString`类，该类实现接口，并且设计为保存这两个 32 位有符号和 32 位无符号的值的字符串表示。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 32-bit signed and 32-bit unsigned values. 该类包括`Sign`属性，指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅，方法假设`value`使用无符号的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，所有的 32 位用于表示的数字值，因而缺少符号位。In other words, all 32 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码在其中一个带符号的整数值超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换到其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"to 2147483648 0x80000000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80000000 converts to 2147483648." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#13)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法或运算符在使用了适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了确保，该方法不恰当地使用二进制表示形式来解释转换的十六进制字符串时使用 2 的补数表示的值的一种值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例可确定某个值是否表示带符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当此示例将值转换为值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，且其高顺序位被设置 （这表明原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#14)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将解释为十六进制值的数字的字符串数组中每个元素并将其转换为无符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt32#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint32/cs/touint32_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt32#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint32/vb/touint32_3.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法相当于传递`value`到方法。Using the method is equivalent to passing `value` to the method. 使用当前线程区域性的格式设置约定解释 `value`。`value` is interpreted by using the formatting conventions of the current thread culture. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例将解释为数字的字符串的字符串数组的元素，并尝试将它们转换为无符号长整数。The following example interprets the elements of a string array as numeric strings and attempts to convert them to unsigned long integers. MemberSignature.Value: public static ulong ToUInt64 (object value, IFormatProvider provider);
.method public static hidebysig unsigned int64 ToUInt64(object value, class System.IFormatProvider provider) cil managed
Public Shared Function ToUInt64 (value As Object, provider As IFormatProvider) As ULong
public: static System::UInt64 ToUInt64(System::Object ^ value, IFormatProvider ^ provider);

param.name: value
param.span: 一个实现 接口的对象。

span.span: An object that implements the interface.

param.name: provider
param.span: 一个提供区域性特定的格式设置信息的对象。

span.span: An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.

summary.span: 使用指定的区域性特定格式信息，将指定对象的值转换为 64 位无符号整数。

span.span: Converts the value of the specified object to a 64-bit unsigned integer, using the specified culture-specific formatting information.

returns.span: 一个与 等效的 64 位无符号整数，如果 为 ，则为零。

span.span: A 64-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to , or zero if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果方法的基础类型`value`。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定的内容的相关的特定于区域性的转换信息`value`。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果`value`是表示数，`provider`无法提供有关用于表示该数字表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略`provider`; 但是，可以使用参数，如果`value`是用户定义类型实现接口。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义`HexString`类，该类实现接口，并且设计为保存这两个 64 位有符号和 64 位无符号的值的字符串表示。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 64-bit signed and 64-bit unsigned values. 该类包括`Sign`属性，指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_4.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_4.vb#17)] 下面的示例演示调用方法传递`HexString`对象作为参数，反过来，调用实现`HexString`类。The following example shows that a call to the method that passes a `HexString` object as a parameter, in turn, calls the implementation of the `HexString` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_4.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_4.vb#18)]

span.span: is not in an appropriate format.
does not implement the interface.
-or-
The conversion is not supported.

span.span: represents a number that is less than or greater than .

MemberSignature.Value: public static ulong ToUInt64 (string value, IFormatProvider provider);
.method public static hidebysig unsigned int64 ToUInt64(string value, class System.IFormatProvider provider) cil managed
Public Shared Function ToUInt64 (value As String, provider As IFormatProvider) As ULong
public: static System::UInt64 ToUInt64(System::String ^ value, IFormatProvider ^ provider);

param.name: value
param.span: 包含要转换的数字的字符串。

span.span: A string that contains the number to convert.

param.name: provider
param.span: 一个提供区域性特定的格式设置信息的对象。

span.span: An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information.

summary.span: 使用指定的区域性特定格式设置信息，将数字的指定字符串表示形式转换为等效的 64 位无符号整数。

span.span: Converts the specified string representation of a number to an equivalent 64-bit unsigned integer, using the specified culture-specific formatting information.

returns.span: 一个与 中数字等效的 64 位无符号整数，如果 为 ，则为 0（零）。

span.span: A 64-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对调用的结果上`value`。The return value is the result of invoking on `value`. `provider` 是实现，它获取对象。`provider` is an implementation that obtains a object. 对象提供的格式的区域性特定信息`value`。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果`provider`是`null`、对象使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. 如果你不愿意处理的异常，如果转换失败，则可以调用方法相反。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个自定义会将字符串"pos"识别为正号和字符串"neg"为负号的对象。The following example defines a custom object that recognizes the string "pos" as the positive sign and the string "neg" as the negative sign. 它会尝试将数字的字符串数组的每个元素转换为无符号长整数。It then attempts to convert each element of a numeric string array to an unsigned long integer. 转换使用这两个自定义提供程序和用于固定区域性的提供程序。The conversion uses both the custom provider and the provider for the invariant culture. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_2.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_2.vb#15)]

exception.span: 不是由一个可选符号后跟数字序列（0 到 9）组成的。

span.span: does not consist of an optional sign followed by a sequence of digits (0 through 9).

exception.span: 表示一个小于 或大于 的数字。

span.span: represents a number that is less than or greater than .

MemberSignature.Value: public static ulong ToUInt64 (string value, int fromBase);
.method public static hidebysig unsigned int64 ToUInt64(string value, int32 fromBase) cil managed
Public Shared Function ToUInt64 (value As String, fromBase As Integer) As ULong
public: static System::UInt64 ToUInt64(System::String ^ value, int fromBase);

param.name: value
param.span: 包含要转换的数字的字符串。

span.span: A string that contains the number to convert.

param.name: fromBase
param.span: value 中数字的基数，它必须是 2、8、10 或 16。

span.span: The base of the number in value, which must be 2, 8, 10, or 16.

summary.span: 将指定基数的数字的字符串表示形式转换为等效的 64 位无符号整数。

span.span: Converts the string representation of a number in a specified base to an equivalent 64-bit unsigned integer.

returns.span: 一个与 中数字等效的 64 位无符号整数，如果 为 ，则为 0（零）。

span.span: A 64-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`fromBase`为 16，你可以通过指定的数字前面`value`以"0x"或"0x"的参数。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 因为数据类型支持无符号的值仅，方法假设`value`使用无符号的二进制表示形式来表示。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换而言之，所有 64 位用于表示的数字值，因而缺少符号位。In other words, all 64 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，它是可以用来编写的代码签名的长整型值，超出了范围的数据类型转换为值，从而不引发异常的方法。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed long integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 以下示例将转换到其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 而不是引发异常，该方法将显示消息"to 9223372036854775808 0x8000000000000000 转换为"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000000000000000 converts to 9223372036854775808." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#15)] 在执行二元运算或数值转换时，始终是开发人员可以验证方法或运算符在使用了适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值的责任。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了确保，该方法不恰当地使用二进制表示形式来解释转换的十六进制字符串时使用 2 的补数表示的值的一种值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例可确定某个值是否表示带符号或无符号的整数时它将该值转换为其字符串表示形式。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当此示例将值转换为值，它将检查原始值是否为有符号的整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，且其高顺序位被设置 （这表明原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#16)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将解释为十六进制值的数字的字符串数组中每个元素并将其转换为无符号长整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned long integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_3.vb#16)]
